translation: Now begins the description of the adoption of a vulture as the Sixteenth Guru

gurmukhi: muK ibBUq Bgvy Bys brM ]suB soBq cylk sMg nrM ]gun gwvq goibMd eyk muKM ]mn folq Aws audws suKM ]359]
transliteration: Moukh Bibhoot Bhagve Bhes Baran|| Soubh Sobhat Chelak San Naran|| Goun Gadvat Gobind Ekmoukhan|| Man Dolat Aas Udaas Soukhan||359||
translation: The sage was alongwith his disciples having smeared his face with ashes and wearing the ochre-coloured clothes; he was singing the praises of the Lord with his mouth and was moving unattached with all kind of desires.359.

gurmukhi: muK pUrq sUrq nwd nvM ]Aiq au`jl AMg ibBUq irKM ]nhI bolq folq dys idsM ]gun cwrq Dwrq hrM ]360]
transliteration: Moukh Poorat Soorat Naad Navan|| At(i) Ujjal An Bibhoot Rikhan|| Nahidolat Dolat Des Disan|| Goun Chaarat Dhaarat Dhyaan Haran||360||
translation: Various sounds were created with the mouth and the sage Dutt’s body was allied with many types of magnificence; he was moving silently in various countries far and near and was meditating on the Lord in his mind.360.

gurmukhi: AivlokX cwvf cwr pRBM ]giH jwq aufI gih mwsu muKM ]liK kY pl cwvMf cwr clI ]iqh qy Aiq puSt pRmwQ blI ]361]
transliteration: Avilokaya Chaavadchaar Prabhan|| Grah(i) Jaat Udi Gadi Maas(u) Moukhan|| Lakh(i) Kai Pal Chaavand Chaar Chalee|| Tih Te At(i) Poushat Pramaath Balee||361||
translation: There he saw a vulture, who was holding a piece of flesh in his mouth and flying; seeing it, more powerful four vultures moved forward.361.

gurmukhi: Avlok smws AkwS aufI ]Aiq ju`Du qhI iqh sMg mMfI ]qj mws cVw auif Awp clI ]lih kY icq cwvf cwr blI ]362]
transliteration: Avlok Samaas Akaadh Udee|| At(i) Juddh(u) Tahitih San Mandee|| Taj Maas Chadaa Ud(i) Aap Chalee|| Lah(i) Kai Chit Chaavadchaar Balee||362||
translation: They flew in the sky and there they began to fight with that vulture; whe dropped the pieced of flesh on seeing these powerful vultures and flew away.362.

gurmukhi: Avlok su cwvf cwr plM ]qij qRws BeI iQr BUm QlM ]liK qws sTM muin cauk rhXo ]icq sorsvo gur qws khXo ]363]
transliteration: Avlok Su Chaavadchaar Palan|| Taj(i) Traas Bhaithir Bhoom Thalan|| Lakh(i) Taas Sathan Mounndi) Chaouk Rahyo|| Chit Sorsavo Gur Taas Kahyo||363||
translation: Seeing those four vulture, even the earth below became stable out of fear seeing them, the sage was startled and adopted them (it) as the Sixteeth Guru.363.

gurmukhi: koaU AYs qjY jb srb DnM ]kir kY ibn Aws audws mnM ]qb pwcau ieMdRI iqAwig rhY ]ien cIln ijau sRuq AYs khY ]364]
transliteration: Ko( i)  Ais Tajai Jab Sarab Dhanan|| Kar(i) Kai Bin Aas Udaas Manan|| Tab Paachay Indritiaag(i) Rahai|| In Cheelan Jio Srout Ais Kahai||364||
translation: If anyone getting unattached with all the desires, forsakes all the assets, then only he can be considered an ascetic; make his understanding like these vultures.364.
End of the description of the adoption of a Vulture as Sidxteenth Guru.
Now begins the description of the adoption of a Fishing Bird as the Seventeenth Guru

gurmukhi: kir sorsvoN irK qws gurM ]auT clIAw bwt audws icqM ]muiK pUrq nwid innwd DunM ]sun rIJq gMDRb dyv nrM ]365]
transliteration: Kar(i) Sorsavon Tikh Taas Guran|| Outh Chaleeaa Baat Udaas Chitan|| Moukh(i) Poorat Naadh Ninaad Dhounan|| Soun Reejhat Gaddhrab Dev Naran||365||
translation: After adopting the vulture as the seventeenth Guru with unattached mind, Dutt proceeded again on his path; he was producing various types of sounds form his mouth and hearing the same, the gods, Gandharvas, men and women, all were getting pleased.365.

gurmukhi: cil jwq Bey sirqw inktM ]hTvMq irKM qpsw ibktM ]Aivlok duDIrX eyk qhwN ]auCrMq huqy nd m`C jhwN ]366]
transliteration: Chal(i) Jaat Bhae Saritaa Nikatan|| Hathvant Rikhanndtapsaa Bikatan|| Avilok Dudheeraya Ek Tahaan|| Ouchhrant Houte Nad Machchh Jahaan||366||
translation: The persistent and ascetic sage reached near a stream, where he saw a flying bird named ‘Mahiggir’ near the jumping fish.366.
